parameter.name: loadEventDB
parameter.description: Number of days to preload events from the database when staring scolv.

parameter.name: magnitudes
parameter.description: List of magnitude types to be calculated when computing magnitudes. This list can be altered interactively so this reflects only the default unless computeMagnitudesSilently is set to true.

parameter.name: visibleMagnitudes
parameter.description: A list of magnitude types to be displayed in the summary widget (F8).

parameter.name: button0
parameter.description: Label of the button that triggers the script defined in "scripts.script0".

parameter.name: button1
parameter.description: Label of the button that triggers the script defined in "scripts.script1".

group.name: scripts
group.description: Define scripts linked to extra buttons. A button is created by definition of the corresponding script.

parameter.name: export
parameter.description: Full path to the script which enables a publish button in the summary panel on the left side of scolv (activated with F8).

parameter.name: script0
parameter.description: Full path to the script executed when hitting the button labeled with "button0". OriginID and EventID are passed to the script as arguments.

parameter.name: script1
parameter.description: Full path to the script executed when hitting the button labeled with "button1". OriginID and EventID are passed to the script as arguments.

parameter.name: silentTerminate
parameter.description: If the publish button is clicked while another script is still running, a message box pops up with a warning that a script is still running and to option to terminate it. If this flag is true, then it will be terminated automatically without user interaction and the warning message.

parameter.name: defaultEventType
parameter.description: Sets the default event type to be used when confirming a solution. If not set, the event type is not changed at all unless "with options" is used. The origin or its source must be associated with an event already.

parameter.name: commonEventTypes
parameter.description: A list of event types which are commonly set. This defines a priority list which will be displayed on top of the event type selection menu. Additionally the remaining (non-prioritized) types are displayed with less contrast. The order is preserved in the event editor as well as in the drop-down list of the "Commit with additional options" dialog.

parameter.name: defaultMagnitudeAggregation
parameter.description: Sets the default magnitude aggregation method. It can be either "mean", "trimmed mean" or "median". If not set, the default behavior is used which computes the mean if less than 4 stations are available, trimmed mean otherwise.

parameter.name: computeMagnitudesAfterRelocate
parameter.description: Automatically starts computation of magnitudes after relocating an origin.

parameter.name: computeMagnitudesSilently
parameter.description: Starts magnitude computation without user interaction if everything runs without errors. In case of errors a window pops up with the current state of processing.

parameter.name: enableMagnitudeSelection
parameter.description: If enabled, a magnitude selection pop window will open in advance to compute magnitudes. The default selection reflects the configuration parameter "magnitudes".

parameter.name: Pvel
parameter.description: The velocity applied to reduce travel times in the "MoveOut" plot of the Location tab.

parameter.name: drawMapLines
parameter.description: Sets the drawing of lines in the map connecting the station with the event.

parameter.name: drawGridLines
parameter.description: Sets the drawing of grid lines in the plot.

parameter.name: computeMissingTakeOffAngles
parameter.description: If a locator does not populate the take off angle in its arrivals, the first motion plot will not show picked polarities. This option defines whether to compute take off angles that are not present in the arrivals or not.

parameter.name: defaultAddStationsDistance
parameter.description: The default value for adding unassociated stations in the picker.

parameter.name: hideStationsWithoutData
parameter.description: If enabled, all traces without data and arrivals are hidden in the picker.

parameter.name: hideDisabledStations
parameter.description: If enabled, all traces of disabled stations without picks are hidden.

parameter.name: defaultDepth
parameter.description: When creating an artificial origin this is the default depth used.

parameter.name: artificialOriginAdvanced
parameter.description: Adds advanced input parameters in artificial origin dialog.

parameter.name: systemTray
parameter.description: Adds an icon to the system tray and displays a message when a new event was received. Note that this feature requires libQt4 version 4.3 or higher.

parameter.name: unassociatedMaxDist
parameter.description: Maximum distance in degrees up to which also unassociated stations are shown in the map. 360.0 deg which will show all unassociated stations.

parameter.name: defaultRadius
parameter.description: Default map radius in degrees if a new event is selected. A negative value restores the default behavior.

parameter.name: visibleColumns
parameter.description: Defines the visible columns in the arrival table. Valid tokens are: Used, Status, Phase, Weight, Method, Polarity, Takeoff, Net, Sta, Loc/Cha, Timeres, Dis, Az, Time, +/-, Slo, Slores, Baz, Bazres, Created, Latency

parameter.name: showUncertainties
parameter.description: Whether the arrival plot should show uncertainties or not by default. That flag can be toggled with 'e' or via the context menu during runtime.

parameter.name: interface
parameter.description: The default locator interface to use.

parameter.name: defaultProfile
parameter.description: The default locator profile to use.

parameter.name: minimumDepth
parameter.description: Minimum depth which is set if the locator used supports fixing the depth. If the depth is lower than this value, the depth is fixed to this configured value and the origin is relocated again.

parameter.name: presetFromOrigin
parameter.description: Whether to preset the locator settings when an origin is being loaded. It tries to figure the locator type from Origin.methodID and the profile from Origin.earthModelID.

parameter.name: forceEventAssociation
parameter.description: Activates the button "Force association with event" when committing with additional options. This is just the default setting and can be changed manually when the dialog pops up.

parameter.name: fixOrigin
parameter.description: Activates the button "Fix this origin as preferred solution" when committing with additional options. This is just the default setting and can be changed manually when the dialog pops up.

parameter.name: returnToEventList
parameter.description: Whether to return to the event list after committing with additional options or not.

parameter.name: eventCommentOptions
parameter.description: Turns the event comment input field into a drop down box allowing the user to select from a list a predefined comment values which may be changed if required.

parameter.name: originComments
parameter.description: A list of origin comment profiles. These profiles will be used to populate origin comments when committing an origin.

group.name: originComments
group.description: The container for all origin comment profiles.

parameter.name: id
parameter.description: The id of the comment to be added, updated or removed.

parameter.name: label
parameter.description: The label shown in the commit dialog.

parameter.name: options
parameter.description: A list of options to select from. Actually the values to populate the dropdown list with.

parameter.name: allowFreeText
parameter.description: If free text is allowed in addition to the predefined values.

group.name: customCommits
group.description: Configure custom commit buttons which behave like shortcuts to "Commit with additional options". Pressing a custom button does not open a popup window. Instead it reads the configured profile and applies the options to the event and origin. Each commit button can be coloured and labeled.

parameter.name: enable
parameter.description: Enable this commit button.

parameter.name: askForConfirmation
parameter.description: Ask for confirmation by presenting the "commit with options" dialog with the options pre-populated from this configuration. Cancelling the dialog aborts the commit procedure.

parameter.name: forceEventAssociation
parameter.description: Associate a new origin to the currently active event or not.

parameter.name: fixOrigin
parameter.description: Fix the origin as preferred solution in the event it is associated to.

parameter.name: eventType
parameter.description: The event type to be set of the event associated with the committed origin. If unset, the type remains unchanged. Use quotes for event types with spaces, e.g. "not existing".

parameter.name: eventTypeCertainty
parameter.description: The event type certainty to be set of the event associated with the committed origin. If unset, the type certainty remains unchanged.

parameter.name: originStatus
parameter.description: The status to be set of the origin being committed. If unset, the status remains unchanged. If empty, the origin status will be set to none.

parameter.name: magnitudeType
parameter.description: Sets the preferred magnitude type of the event. If unset, no changes will be requested. If empty, the currently fixed preferred magnitude type will be reset.

parameter.name: eventName
parameter.description: Optional event name which will be set. This option exists for completeness and does not make much sense to be applied on any event. Use quotes for event names with spaces, e.g. "Quarry XYZ".

parameter.name: eventComment
parameter.description: Optional event comment which will be set. Use quotes for event comments with spaces, e.g. "Blast on Monday morning".

parameter.name: returnToEventList
parameter.description: Return to the event list after committing or not.

parameter.name: label
parameter.description: The commit button label. Use quotes for labels with spaces, e.g. "Earthquake reported".

parameter.name: color
parameter.description: Optional primary color for the bulk commit button. Use hexadecimal values.

parameter.name: colorText
parameter.description: Optional text color for the bulk commit button. Use hexadecimal values.

parameter.name: tooltip
parameter.description: Add a summary of the actions to the button's tooltip.

parameter.name: magnitudeComments
parameter.description: A list of magnitude comment profiles. These profiles will be used to populate magnitude comments when committing a magnitude.

group.name: magnitudeComments
group.description: The container for all magnitude comment profiles.

parameter.name: id
parameter.description: The id of the comment to be added, updated or removed.

parameter.name: label
parameter.description: The label shown in the magnitude view.

parameter.name: options
parameter.description: A list of options to select from. Actually the values to populate the dropdown list with.

parameter.name: allowFreeText
parameter.description: If free text is allowed in addition to the predefined values.

group.name: picker
group.description: Parameters controlling the phase picker window.

parameter.name: showCrossHairCursor
parameter.description: Activate a cross hair cursor showing the configured uncertainties when in picking mode.

parameter.name: loadAllPicks
parameter.description: Load all existing picks for the requested data time window.

parameter.name: ignoreUnconfiguredStations
parameter.description: If enabled, the picker will not add stations that are not configured with a detecStream in global bindings.

parameter.name: limitStationAcquisition
parameter.description: Limit the data acquisition to the number of nearest stations given by "picker.limitStationAcquisitionCount".

parameter.name: limitStationAcquisitionCount
parameter.description: Limit the data acquisituion to the given number of the nearest stations. Requires to activate "picker.limitStationAcquisition".

parameter.name: loadStrongMotion
parameter.description: If enabled, acceleration data is loaded for co-located stations where picked on velocity data.

parameter.name: loadAllComponents
parameter.description: Load all three components by default. If disabled, additional components are fetched upon request.

parameter.name: showAllComponents
parameter.description: If enabled, all three components are shown in the picker zoom trace. The distance is limited to what is configured in "picker.allComponentsMaximumDistance".

parameter.name: allComponentsMaximumDistance
parameter.description: The distance limit for the "picker.showAllComponents" flag.

parameter.name: usePerStreamTimeWindows
parameter.description: If enabled, data is requested around the P pick for each stations. Otherwise origin time is used and the time window for all stations is the same.

parameter.name: removeAutomaticPicksFromStationAfterManualReview
parameter.description: After picking and pushing the solution back to scolv all automatic arrivals are removed from a station if a manual pick exists.

parameter.name: removeAllAutomaticPicksAfterManualReview
parameter.description: After picking and pushing the solution back to scolv all automatic arrivals are removed from all stations regardless if a manual pick exists or not.

parameter.name: preOffset
parameter.description: The data time span added to the left of either origin time or first arrival depending on the usePerStreamTimeWindows flag.

parameter.name: postOffset
parameter.description: The data time span added to the right of the requested time window.

parameter.name: minimumTimeWindow
parameter.description: Minimum data time window length.

parameter.name: alignmentPosition
parameter.description: Defines the relative position of the alignment when traces are aligned at a phase. This value is bound to interval [0:1] where 0 is the left side and 1 is right side of the trace window.

parameter.name: repickerStart
parameter.description: Start of the re-picker time window relative the cursor position on the trace.

parameter.name: repickerEnd
parameter.description: End of the re-picker time window relative the cursor position on the trace.

parameter.name: filters
parameter.description: List of filters available in the picker. Format: "name1;filter-definition1", "name2;filter-definition2"

parameter.name: velocityChannelCodes
parameter.description: A list of channel codes to be used when searching for velocity channels. Usually this information is part of the meta data. In case it is not, this list is used.

parameter.name: accelerationChannelCodes
parameter.description: A list of channel codes to be used when searching for acceleration channels. Usually this information is part of the meta data. In case it is not, this list is used.

parameter.name: showPhases
parameter.description: Phases for which theoretical arrival times are shown.

parameter.name: phases
parameter.description: A list of phases that is available for picking in the Picking menu. The phases are not accessible through hot keys as for "picker.phases.favourites". The phases are considered if the more complex phase group definition "picker.phases.groups" is not provided.

parameter.name: uncertainties
parameter.description: List of pre-defined pick uncertainties. The format of each list item is either a double value or a pair of double values for asymmetric uncertainties, e.g. "val1","(val2,val3)". This parameter is only used if "picker.uncertainties.preferred" is undefined.

parameter.name: componentFollowsMouse
parameter.description: If enabled then the currently selected component for all traces will be activated according to the mouse position in the zoom trace (old behaviour). If disabled (default) then only the component of the zoom trace will change but the overall component will stay the same. It must be changed explicitely.

group.name: auxiliary
group.description: Define the notion and behaviour of auxiliary channels. They are identified through configurable patterns and if identified as such they will be treated differently in defined situations.

parameter.name: channels
parameter.description: A list of wildcard patterns to identify auxiliary channels. A pattern is simply checked against a stream ID, the concatenation of NSLC separated by a period.

parameter.name: minimumDistance
parameter.description: The minimum distance in degrees from origin to load an unassociated auxiliary channel. Loading a channel / station explicitely (F3) will not respect this setting.

parameter.name: maximumDistance
parameter.description: The maximum distance in degrees from origin to load an unassociated auxiliary channel. Loading a channel / station explicitely (F3) will not respect this setting.

group.name: phases
group.description: Phases defined for picking. The phase phases can be selected from the Picking menu of the picker window. Make sure, the locator can handle all defined phases.

parameter.name: favourites
parameter.description: Phase types available for rapid picking by hot keys and in the Picking menu. Separate the types by comma.

parameter.name: groups
parameter.description: List of defined phase type profiles to be considered. Separate profiles by comma.

group.name: groups
group.description: Definiton of phase type profiles. The profiles and phase types can be selected from the Picking menu of the picker window but not with hot keys.

parameter.description: List of phase types. Separate types by comma.

group.name: uncertainties
group.description: Define uncertainty profiles. Once defined, they can be selected in the scolv picker settings [F3]. The profiles override uncertainties defined in "uncertainties".

parameter.name: preferred
parameter.description: Pick uncertainty profiles to be loaded. The first profile will be used by default.
List of pre-defined pick uncertainties. The format of each list item is either a double value or a pair of double values for asymmetric uncertainties, e.g. "val1","(val2,val3)".

group.name: integration
group.description: Settings related to waveform integration which may be required if the desired waveform unit is changed and the sensor data must be integrated once or multiple times.

parameter.name: preFilter
parameter.description: An optional pre-filter which is applied prior to the numerical integration to stabilize the result. This filter is applied for each integration step or just once depending on the parameter "applyOnce". Multiple integrations are necessary if acceleration data should be converted to displacement.

parameter.name: applyOnce
parameter.description: Whether to apply the pre-filter only prior the first integration step or prior to each step.

group.name: amplitudePicker
group.description: Parameters controlling the amplitude picker window for computing station magnitudes.

parameter.name: preOffset
parameter.description: Time span in seconds to be added to the left of the used amplitude time window.

parameter.name: postOffset
parameter.description: Time span in seconds to be added to the right of the used amplitude time window.

parameter.name: filters
parameter.description: A list of filters used for the amplitude picker. Format: "name1;filter-definition1", "name2;filter-definition2"

group.name: display
group.description: Display custom information in the Location tab.

parameter.name: addons
parameter.description: Name(s) of quality addon profile(s) to be considered. The profiles provide values through a script which are shown in the location tab. The scolv documentation provides an example script.

parameter.name: id
parameter.description: ID of the origin comment to be considered.

parameter.name: default
parameter.description: Value to be shown in case no valid origin comment is found.

parameter.name: label
parameter.description: Label of the value to be shown.

parameter.name: label
parameter.description: Defines the label text of the information panel in the Location tab of the parameter evaluated by this addon.

parameter.name: script
parameter.description: Path to script to execute.

option.description: Do not use the database at all
Preload origin with given origin ID
Preload event with given event ID
Load events in given XML file during startup and switch to offline mode
Number of days to load from database
